subcommands.name: skopeo copy
subcommands.raw_help_text:
Container "IMAGE-NAME" uses a "transport":"details" format.

Supported transports:
containers-storage, dir, docker, docker-archive, docker-daemon, oci, oci-archive, sif, tarball

See skopeo(1) section "IMAGE NAMES" for the expected format

Usage:
skopeo copy [command options] SOURCE-IMAGE DESTINATION-IMAGE

Examples:
skopeo copy docker://quay.io/skopeo/stable:latest docker://registry.example.com/skopeo:latest

Flags:
      --additional-tag strings                additional tags (supports docker-archive)
  -a, --all                                   Copy all images if SOURCE-IMAGE is a list
      --authfile string                       path of the registry credentials file. Default is ${XDG_RUNTIME_DIR}/containers/auth.json (default "/tmp/auth.json")
      --decryption-key strings                *Experimental* key needed to decrypt the image
      --dest-authfile string                  path of the registry credentials file. Default is ${XDG_RUNTIME_DIR}/containers/auth.json
      --dest-cert-dir PATH                    use certificates at PATH (*.crt, *.cert, *.key) to connect to the registry or daemon
      --dest-compress                         Compress tarball image layers when saving to directory using the 'dir' transport. (default is same compression type as source)
      --dest-compress-format FORMAT           FORMAT to use for the compression
      --dest-compress-level LEVEL             LEVEL to use for the compression
      --dest-creds USERNAME[:PASSWORD]        Use USERNAME[:PASSWORD] for accessing the registry
      --dest-daemon-host HOST                 use docker daemon host at HOST (docker-daemon: only)
      --dest-decompress                       Decompress tarball image layers when saving to directory using the 'dir' transport. (default is same compression type as source)
      --dest-no-creds                         Access the registry anonymously
      --dest-oci-accept-uncompressed-layers   Allow uncompressed image layers when saving to an OCI image using the 'oci' transport. (default is to compress things that aren't compressed)
      --dest-password string                  Password for accessing the registry
      --dest-precompute-digests               Precompute digests to prevent uploading layers already on the registry using the 'docker' transport.
      --dest-registry-token string            Provide a Bearer token for accessing the registry
      --dest-shared-blob-dir DIRECTORY        DIRECTORY to use to share blobs across OCI repositories
      --dest-tls-verify                       require HTTPS and verify certificates when talking to the container registry or daemon
      --dest-username string                  Username for accessing the registry
      --digestfile string                     Write the digest of the pushed image to the specified file
      --encrypt-layer ints                    *Experimental* the 0-indexed layer indices, with support for negative indexing (e.g. 0 is the first layer, -1 is the last layer)
      --encryption-key strings                *Experimental* key with the encryption protocol to use needed to encrypt the image (e.g. jwe:/path/to/key.pem)
  -f, --format string                         MANIFEST TYPE (oci, v2s1, or v2s2) to use in the destination (default is manifest type of source, with fallbacks)
  -h, --help                                  help for copy
      --image-parallel-copies uint            Maximum number of image layers to be copied (pulled/pushed) simultaneously. Not setting this field will fall back to containers/image defaults.
      --multi-arch string                     How to handle multi-architecture images (system, all, or index-only)
      --preserve-digests                      Preserve digests of images and lists
  -q, --quiet                                 Suppress output information when copying images
      --remove-signatures                     Do not copy signatures from source
      --retry-delay duration                  Fixed delay between retries. If not set, retry uses an exponential backoff delay.
      --retry-times int                       the number of times to possibly retry
      --sign-by FINGERPRINT                   Sign the image using a GPG key with the specified FINGERPRINT
      --sign-by-sigstore PATH                 Sign the image using a sigstore parameter file at PATH
      --sign-by-sigstore-private-key PATH     Sign the image using a sigstore private key at PATH
      --sign-identity string                  Identity of signed image, must be a fully specified docker reference. Defaults to the target docker reference.
      --sign-passphrase-file PATH             Read a passphrase for signing an image from PATH
      --src-authfile string                   path of the registry credentials file. Default is ${XDG_RUNTIME_DIR}/containers/auth.json
      --src-cert-dir PATH                     use certificates at PATH (*.crt, *.cert, *.key) to connect to the registry or daemon
      --src-creds USERNAME[:PASSWORD]         Use USERNAME[:PASSWORD] for accessing the registry
      --src-daemon-host HOST                  use docker daemon host at HOST (docker-daemon: only)
      --src-no-creds                          Access the registry anonymously
      --src-password string                   Password for accessing the registry
      --src-registry-token string             Provide a Bearer token for accessing the registry
      --src-shared-blob-dir DIRECTORY         DIRECTORY to use to share blobs across OCI repositories
      --src-tls-verify                        require HTTPS and verify certificates when talking to the container registry or daemon
      --src-username string                   Username for accessing the registry
subcommands.description: Copy an IMAGE-NAME from one location to another

subcommands.name: skopeo delete
subcommands.raw_help_text:
Delete an "IMAGE_NAME" from a transport
Supported transports:
containers-storage, dir, docker, docker-archive, docker-daemon, oci, oci-archive, sif, tarball
See skopeo(1) section "IMAGE NAMES" for the expected format

Usage:
skopeo delete [command options] IMAGE-NAME

Examples:
skopeo delete docker://registry.example.com/example/pause:latest

Flags:
      --authfile string             path of the registry credentials file. Default is ${XDG_RUNTIME_DIR}/containers/auth.json (default "/tmp/auth.json")
      --cert-dir PATH               use certificates at PATH (*.crt, *.cert, *.key) to connect to the registry or daemon
      --creds USERNAME[:PASSWORD]   Use USERNAME[:PASSWORD] for accessing the registry
      --daemon-host HOST            use docker daemon host at HOST (docker-daemon: only)
  -h, --help                        help for delete
      --no-creds                    Access the registry anonymously
      --password string             Password for accessing the registry
      --registry-token string       Provide a Bearer token for accessing the registry
      --retry-delay duration        Fixed delay between retries. If not set, retry uses an exponential backoff delay.
      --retry-times int             the number of times to possibly retry
      --shared-blob-dir DIRECTORY   DIRECTORY to use to share blobs across OCI repositories
      --tls-verify                  require HTTPS and verify certificates when talking to the container registry or daemon
      --username string             Username for accessing the registry

options.description: help for generate-sigstore-key
Write the keys to PREFIX.pub and `PREFIX`.private
Read a passphrase for the private key from PATH

subcommands.name: skopeo generate-sigstore-key
subcommands.raw_help_text:
Generate a sigstore public/private key pair

Usage:
skopeo generate-sigstore-key [command options] --output-prefix PREFIX

Examples:
skopeo generate-sigstore-key --output-prefix my-key

Flags:
  -h, --help                   help for generate-sigstore-key
      --output-prefix PREFIX   Write the keys to PREFIX.pub and `PREFIX`.private
      --passphrase-file PATH   Read a passphrase for the private key from PATH
subcommands.description: Generate a sigstore public/private key pair

subcommands.name: skopeo inspect
subcommands.raw_help_text:
Return low-level information about "IMAGE-NAME" in a registry/transport
Supported transports:
containers-storage, dir, docker, docker-archive, docker-daemon, oci, oci-archive, sif, tarball

See skopeo(1) section "IMAGE NAMES" for the expected format

Usage:
skopeo inspect [command options] IMAGE-NAME

Examples:
skopeo inspect docker://registry.fedoraproject.org/fedora
skopeo inspect --config docker://docker.io/alpine
skopeo inspect --format "Name: {{.Name}} Digest: {{.Digest}}" docker://registry.access.redhat.com/ubi8

Flags:
      --authfile string             path of the registry credentials file. Default is ${XDG_RUNTIME_DIR}/containers/auth.json (default "/tmp/auth.json")
      --cert-dir PATH               use certificates at PATH (*.crt, *.cert, *.key) to connect to the registry or daemon
      --config                      output configuration
      --creds USERNAME[:PASSWORD]   Use USERNAME[:PASSWORD] for accessing the registry
      --daemon-host HOST            use docker daemon host at HOST (docker-daemon: only)
  -f, --format string               Format the output to a Go template
  -h, --help                        help for inspect
      --no-creds                    Access the registry anonymously
  -n, --no-tags                     Do not list the available tags from the repository in the output
      --password string             Password for accessing the registry
      --raw                         output raw manifest or configuration
      --registry-token string       Provide a Bearer token for accessing the registry
      --retry-delay duration        Fixed delay between retries. If not set, retry uses an exponential backoff delay.
      --retry-times int             the number of times to possibly retry
      --shared-blob-dir DIRECTORY   DIRECTORY to use to share blobs across OCI repositories
      --tls-verify                  require HTTPS and verify certificates when talking to the container registry or daemon
      --username string             Username for accessing the registry

use certificates at PATH (*.crt, *.cert, *.key) to connect to the registry or daemon

subcommands.name: skopeo list-tags
subcommands.raw_help_text:
Return the list of tags from the transport/repository "SOURCE-IMAGE"

Supported transports:
docker docker-archive

See skopeo-list-tags(1) section "REPOSITORY NAMES" for the expected format

Usage:
skopeo list-tags [command options] SOURCE-IMAGE

Examples:
skopeo list-tags docker://docker.io/fedora

Flags:
      --authfile string             path of the registry credentials file. Default is ${XDG_RUNTIME_DIR}/containers/auth.json (default "/tmp/auth.json")
      --cert-dir PATH               use certificates at PATH (*.crt, *.cert, *.key) to connect to the registry or daemon
      --creds USERNAME[:PASSWORD]   Use USERNAME[:PASSWORD] for accessing the registry
  -h, --help                        help for list-tags
      --no-creds                    Access the registry anonymously
      --password string             Password for accessing the registry
      --registry-token string       Provide a Bearer token for accessing the registry
      --retry-delay duration        Fixed delay between retries. If not set, retry uses an exponential backoff delay.
      --retry-times int             the number of times to possibly retry
      --tls-verify                  require HTTPS and verify certificates when talking to the container registry or daemon
      --username string             Username for accessing the registry
subcommands.description: List tags in the transport/repository specified by the SOURCE-IMAGE

options.description: path of the authentication file. Use REGISTRY_AUTH_FILE environment variable to override
use certificates at the specified path to access the registry
path of a Docker-compatible config file to update instead
Return the current login user for the registry
help for login
Password for registry
Take the password from stdin
require HTTPS and verify certificates when accessing the registry
Username for registry
Write more detailed information to stdout

subcommands.name: skopeo login
subcommands.raw_help_text:
Login to a container registry on a specified server.

Usage:
skopeo login [command options] REGISTRY

Examples:
skopeo login quay.io

Flags:
      --authfile string           path of the authentication file. Use REGISTRY_AUTH_FILE environment variable to override
      --cert-dir string           use certificates at the specified path to access the registry
      --compat-auth-file string   path of a Docker-compatible config file to update instead
      --get-login                 Return the current login user for the registry
  -h, --help                      help for login
  -p, --password string           Password for registry
      --password-stdin            Take the password from stdin
      --tls-verify                require HTTPS and verify certificates when accessing the registry
  -u, --username string           Username for registry
  -v, --verbose                   Write more detailed information to stdout

options.description: path of the authentication file. Use REGISTRY_AUTH_FILE environment variable to override
path of a Docker-compatible config file to update instead
help for logout
require HTTPS and verify certificates when accessing the registry
Remove the cached credentials for all registries in the auth file

subcommands.name: skopeo logout
subcommands.raw_help_text:
Logout of a container registry on a specified server.

Usage:
skopeo logout [command options] REGISTRY

Examples:
skopeo logout quay.io

Flags:
  -a, --all                       Remove the cached credentials for all registries in the auth file
      --authfile string           path of the authentication file. Use REGISTRY_AUTH_FILE environment variable to override
      --compat-auth-file string   path of a Docker-compatible config file to update instead
  -h, --help                      help for logout
      --tls-verify                require HTTPS and verify certificates when accessing the registry

options.description: help for manifest-digest

subcommands.name: skopeo manifest-digest
subcommands.raw_help_text:
Compute a manifest digest of a file

Usage:
skopeo manifest-digest MANIFEST-FILE

Examples:
skopeo manifest-digest manifest.json

Flags:
  -h, --help   help for manifest-digest
subcommands.description: Compute a manifest digest of a file

options.description: help for standalone-sign
output the signature to SIGNATURE
file that contains a passphrase for the --sign-by key

subcommands.name: skopeo standalone-sign
subcommands.raw_help_text:
Create a signature using local files

Usage:
skopeo standalone-sign [command options] MANIFEST DOCKER-REFERENCE KEY-FINGERPRINT --output|-o SIGNATURE

Flags:
  -h, --help                     help for standalone-sign
  -o, --output SIGNATURE         output the signature to SIGNATURE
      --passphrase-file string   file that contains a passphrase for the --sign-by key
subcommands.description: Create a signature using local files

options.description: help for standalone-verify
File containing public keys. If not specified, will use local GPG keys.

subcommands.name: skopeo standalone-verify
subcommands.raw_help_text:
Verify a signature using local files

KEY-FINGERPRINTS can be a comma separated list of fingerprints, or "any" if you trust all the keys in the public key file.

Usage:
skopeo standalone-verify MANIFEST DOCKER-REFERENCE KEY-FINGERPRINTS SIGNATURE

Flags:
  -h, --help                     help for standalone-verify
      --public-key-file string   File containing public keys. If not specified, will use local GPG keys.
subcommands.description: Verify a signature using local files

subcommands.name: skopeo sync
subcommands.raw_help_text:
Copy all the images from a SOURCE to a DESTINATION.

Allowed SOURCE transports (specified with --src): docker, dir, yaml.
Allowed DESTINATION transports (specified with --dest): docker, dir.

See skopeo-sync(1) for details.

Usage:
skopeo sync [command options] --src TRANSPORT --dest TRANSPORT SOURCE DESTINATION

Examples:
skopeo sync --src docker --dest dir --scoped registry.example.com/busybox /media/usb

Flags:
  -a, --all                                 Copy all images if SOURCE-IMAGE is a list
      --append-suffix string                String to append to DESTINATION tags
      --authfile string                     path of the registry credentials file. Default is ${XDG_RUNTIME_DIR}/containers/auth.json (default "/tmp/auth.json")
  -d, --dest string                         DESTINATION transport type
      --dest-authfile string                path of the registry credentials file. Default is ${XDG_RUNTIME_DIR}/containers/auth.json
      --dest-cert-dir PATH                  use certificates at PATH (*.crt, *.cert, *.key) to connect to the registry or daemon
      --dest-creds USERNAME[:PASSWORD]      Use USERNAME[:PASSWORD] for accessing the registry
      --dest-no-creds                       Access the registry anonymously
      --dest-password string                Password for accessing the registry
      --dest-registry-token string          Provide a Bearer token for accessing the registry
      --dest-tls-verify                     require HTTPS and verify certificates when talking to the container registry or daemon
      --dest-username string                Username for accessing the registry
      --digestfile string                   Write the digests and Image References of the resulting images to the specified file, separated by newlines
      --dry-run                             Run without actually copying data
  -f, --format string                       MANIFEST TYPE (oci, v2s1, or v2s2) to use in the destination (default is manifest type of source, with fallbacks)
  -h, --help                                help for sync
      --keep-going                          Do not abort the sync if any image copy fails
      --preserve-digests                    Preserve digests of images and lists
      --remove-signatures                   Do not copy signatures from source
      --retry-delay duration                Fixed delay between retries. If not set, retry uses an exponential backoff delay.
      --retry-times int                     the number of times to possibly retry
      --scoped                              Images at DESTINATION are prefix using the full source image path as scope
      --sign-by FINGERPRINT                 Sign the image using a GPG key with the specified FINGERPRINT
      --sign-by-sigstore PATH               Sign the image using a sigstore parameter file at PATH
      --sign-by-sigstore-private-key PATH   Sign the image using a sigstore private key at PATH
      --sign-passphrase-file PATH           Read a passphrase for signing an image from PATH
  -s, --src string                          SOURCE transport type
      --src-authfile string                 path of the registry credentials file. Default is ${XDG_RUNTIME_DIR}/containers/auth.json
      --src-cert-dir PATH                   use certificates at PATH (*.crt, *.cert, *.key) to connect to the registry or daemon
      --src-creds USERNAME[:PASSWORD]       Use USERNAME[:PASSWORD] for accessing the registry
      --src-no-creds                        Access the registry anonymously
      --src-password string                 Password for accessing the registry
      --src-registry-token string           Provide a Bearer token for accessing the registry
      --src-tls-verify                      require HTTPS and verify certificates when talking to the container registry or daemon
      --src-username string                 Username for accessing the registry
subcommands.description: Synchronize one or more images from one location to another

options.description: timeout for the command execution
enable debug output
help for skopeo
run the tool without any policy check
use ARCH instead of the architecture of the machine for choosing images
use OS instead of the running OS for choosing images
use VARIANT instead of the running architecture variant for choosing images
Path to a trust policy file
use registry configuration files in DIR (e.g. for container signature storage)
directory used to store temporary files
Version for Skopeo

raw_help_text:
Various operations with container images and container image registries

Usage:
  skopeo [flags]
  skopeo [command]

Available Commands:
  copy                                          Copy an IMAGE-NAME from one location to another
  delete                                        Delete image IMAGE-NAME
  generate-sigstore-key                         Generate a sigstore public/private key pair
  help                                          Help about any command
  inspect                                       Inspect image IMAGE-NAME
  list-tags                                     List tags in the transport/repository specified by the SOURCE-IMAGE
  login                                         Login to a container registry
  logout                                        Logout of a container registry
  manifest-digest                               Compute a manifest digest of a file
  standalone-sign                               Create a signature using local files
  standalone-verify                             Verify a signature using local files
  sync                                          Synchronize one or more images from one location to another

Flags:
      --command-timeout duration   timeout for the command execution
      --debug                      enable debug output
  -h, --help                       help for skopeo
      --insecure-policy            run the tool without any policy check
      --override-arch ARCH         use ARCH instead of the architecture of the machine for choosing images
      --override-os OS             use OS instead of the running OS for choosing images
      --override-variant VARIANT   use VARIANT instead of the running architecture variant for choosing images
      --policy string              Path to a trust policy file
      --registries.d DIR           use registry configuration files in DIR (e.g. for container signature storage)
      --tmpdir string              directory used to store temporary files
  -v, --version                    Version for Skopeo

Use "skopeo [command] --help" for more information about a command.
